Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.

Name of a unique world map sector.
A header name of a task. "Configuration" refers to the "Grail Configuration", an in game structure type.
A name of a task. "Configuration" refers to the "Grail Configuration", an in game structure type.

You can win this map by finding and securing the Prime Grail Configuration. But you will loose, if the Assembly finds it first![br/][br/]Your progress: {INT_0}/{INT_1} steps completed[br/]Assembly's progress: ???/{INT_3} steps completed
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

You can win this map by finding and securing the Prime Grail Configuration. But you will loose, if the Assembly finds it first![br/][br/]Your progress: {INT_0}/{INT_1} steps completed[br/]Assembly's progress: {INT_2}/{INT_3} steps completed
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Your progress: {INT_0}/{INT_1} steps completed[br/]Assembly's progress: ???/{INT_3} steps completed
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Your progress: {INT_0}/{INT_1} steps completed[br/]Assembly's progress: {INT_2}/{INT_3} steps completed
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Victory Condition: The Battle for Union Prime
A header name of a task. "Union Prime" is the name of the planet the mission plays on. See also the corresponding glossary entry.

Use the power of the Prime Grail Configuration to fend off the opposing factions and claim Union Prime for your new-formed alliance.[br/][br/]Enemy Commanders Defeated: {INT_0}/{INT_1}[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: open the operations panel to prime the Doctrine granted to you by the Grail Configuration landmark. You must defend the landmark to keep the powerful Doctrine active!)[recommendedcol/]
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Equis Weviere has tasked you with setting up the unique scanner that the Oathbound created for finding the Cyphers containing the secrets of Grail Configurations.
A task descripiton. For the task name see the corresponding entry in the Grails.xml.
A scanner developed by the Seers to uncover the locations of the unique Grail Cyphers.
A colony production option descripiton. For the name see the corresponding entry in the Grails.xml.

Equis Denard, Equis {STR_LeaderName}, welcome to Union Prime! It is an honor to have the two fresh members of our Circle by my side, even if the decision to not send the most experienced paladins on this vital mission came as something of a surprise. The ways of Oracle can be mysterious.

Story message. Speaker: "Louise Weviere" (Oathbound, female) "Circle" refers to the "Circle of Heroes" (see corresponding glossary entry). "Equis" is the title of an Oathbound Paladin ruling a planet. For "Oracle" see the corresponding glossary entry.

They certainly can! The Seers must have foreseen that our different skillsets will complement each other’s abilities the best to face the dangers ahead.[br/][br/]I thank you for your trust, Equis Weviere. You shall not be disappointed.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) For "Seers" see the corresponding glossary entry.

It is true that the capabilities are not evenly distributed amongst our party of leadership. But neither of you needs to worry: when everything else fails, Equis Denard will come out and heroically save the day!

Let’s hope it won’t come to that. For now, quickness will be our greatest weapon. We must find and recover the Grail Configuration before the Assembly does. It’s that simple.[br/][br/]Equis Denard, your headquarters are closest to the landing point of our enemies. You will be setting up our first line of defense.

Equis {STR_LeaderName}, you are entrusted with the scanning device we brought to locate the Cyphers leading to the Grail Configuration. Assemble it in your colonies.[br/][br/]As for myself, I will pay a silent visit to the Assembly headquarters to monitor their next steps.

I am glad to have you back by my side, Vrascal! Your new robes suit you – that promotion was well-deserved, no doubt.[br/][br/]But how are things faring on the Equisat of Verdrice? I hope the people there survived the Void link of that accursed Assembly device!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Equisat of Verdrice" is the name of the planet the first Oathbound mission played on.

Equisat of {STR_LeaderName} is what you mean to say, my outgrown student. We don’t honor the name of that Apostate anymore. But the planet is safe, yes. There was some turmoil and shake-up, however nothing that couldn’t be handled.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male) "Equisat of NAME" is the naming the Oathbound use to name some of the planets governed by an Equis.
As for my “promotion”, that is not how things work for us Seers. Nonetheless I accept this new role Oracle entrusted me with. In either case, your enthusiasm is duly noted.
Story message. Speaker: "Vrascal the Seer" (Oathbound, male)
You certainly haven’t changed, Vrascal! Welcome back![br/][br/]Now, on to you, Narwa. I heard good things from our Celestian brothers and sisters about your recovery.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Studying the Code d’Equise a second time has filled my heart with peacefulness and anticipation. The time of humility and meditation led me back to the roots of what it means to be Oathbound Paladin.
Story message. Speaker: "Narwa the Redeemed" (Oathbound, female) "Code d'Equise" is the name of a book and code of honor.
Then you are ready to return into the light. Wear this new battlesuit with dignity. It shall serve our people as a reminder that there are no lost sheep among the Oathbound.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

You certainly haven’t changed, Vrascal! Welcome back![br/][br/]Now, on to you, Rodun Thalm. You did well during our time on the Equisat of Verdrice and are an Aspirant no longer. With the authority granted to me by the High Paladius and his Seers, I affirm your new rank and duties.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) "Aspirant" refers to Paladin Aspirant, an in game unit.

Thank you, my Equis. I am honored to receive the trust and recognition that becoming a Paladin Steward entails. But my biggest reward will be to continue serving under your inspiring leadership. I pledge my life to follow you.
Story message. Speaker: "Rodun Thalm" (Oathbound, male) "Steward" is a title given to a Paladin governing a colony.

Attention, scavenging rabble! As the Prefect of Union Prime, I have declared martial law until all riots are squashed. Hand in your weapons now, or prepare to make acquaintance with the pacifier division of the Paragon military force. The Star Union does not tolerate anarchy!
Story message. Speaker: "Codran Lex" (Paragon, male) "Prefect" is the name of a Paragon governing a planet.

Paragon Prefect? Star Union? Are you even aware that the empire that granted you legitimation has collapsed and been rotting away for more than 200 years? None of us grew up under Paragon rule. We are Oathbound.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Don’t try to give history lessons to a man who has outlived dozens of generations. When I activated the emergency shield of Union Prime, the shockwave from the Cataclysm was only moments away. 200 years of confinement within the Void, but I always knew that the Emperor – and his empire – would return to save his loyal followers.
Story message. Speaker: "Codran Lex" (Paragon, male) For "Cataclysm" see the corresponding glossary title.

And still you are at fault. The ones that pulled you out of the shadows are not any less erratic or destructive than the Void itself. Once Union Prime has been reassembled to the plans of the Assembly, you will wish it had stayed where it was before.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Fatuous boy! You cannot dare to fathom what it means to have existed where no man should dwell, to witness the tightening grip of the Abyss while the energy shield protecting you and your people is slowly starting to crack under the pressure of centuries!

Fatuous girl! You cannot dare to fathom what it means to have existed where no man should dwell, to witness the tightening grip of the Abyss while the energy shield protecting you and your people is slowly starting to crack under the pressure of centuries!

The Assembly are getting the welcome they deserve – for twisting the legacy of Paragon Inc. beyond recognition.[br/][br/]As for you… there is something oddly familiar about your presence. I have a feeling we will be talking again soon.
Story message. Speaker: "Codran Lex" (Paragon, male) "Paragon Inc." is the name of a company.
Human specimens, type delta-3. Physical capabilities: low. Technological state: above-average. Self-designated name: Oathbound. We have expected your arrival. Accuracy of our time estimation: 96.6%.

You can spare us your superiority-inflated data bragging. Without the despicable acts of the ones who betrayed their oaths, you wouldn’t even know about the existence of the Grail Configurations, much less gotten within their reach.

And this is why you will fail. Disunity entails weakness. Did you know that through our multiplexer L0G3N-1 I can hear the thoughts of every Assembly individual scattered throughout the galaxy? We are all a big family.
Story message. Speaker: "Ellen Shaw" (Assembly, female) "L0G3N-1" is the name of a male Assembly character.
A big family of monsters! Luckily, I am an expert in killing multi-headed beasts. Before the stub can grow back, my volt lance will have dealt a dozen deadly blows on top!

Your confidence is commendable, yet ill-founded. We have analyzed the equipment of the individuals you call Apostates. Their technological and biological features have been added to our arsenal of integrated weapons.
But why do any of this? If you say you seek unity, why do you force your form of existence onto others? Can’t you let the rest of the galaxy live in peace?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
The judgement of humanoid races is skewed by their fear of the unknown. What they cannot recognize they will never desire to become. Once Reassembly is complete, you all will understand.
Story message. Speaker: "Ellen Shaw" (Assembly, female) For "Reassembly" see the corresponding glossary entry.

Peace be with you, humans! I am Swarm Herald Chin Til’Trz of the Egalitarian League of Planets. We have heard much good about the way you govern and care for your people, yet there has been no occasion for diplomatic contact since your faction emerged from their self-imposed isolation. This could be an opportune moment to change that.
Story message. Speaker: "Chin Til'Trz" (Kir'Ko, male) "Swarm Herald" is a Kir'Ko title. For "Egalitarian League of Planets" (short ELOP), see the corresponding glossary entry.

Meeting you is likewise our pleasure, Swarm Herald of the Kir’Ko. Your confederation is an inspiring example of inter-racial cooperation. There seems to be much that your leadership and ours have in common.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Well spoken! I can foresee a prospering relationship between ELOP Confederation and Oathbound. One day, we might even swarm together, united in one galactic civilization.

Let’s not get ahead of ourselves. There are two vital achievements that set us Oathbound apart from the other races. The first is our oath and our code of honor, the Code d’Equise. The second is Oracle and its wisdom, as it is brought to us by the Seers. Only by embracing both can outsiders join our society.

I disagree, Equis Weviere. Our oath can be pledged by anyone with the heart of a lion and the constitution of a noble steed. It doesn’t take a group of mystics to predict that he who chooses to truthfully follow my example can be shaped into a hero!

I do not want to bring turmoil into the unity of your swarm. Forgive my hasty proposals of excitement. Though I must warn that we had to fight hard to free ourselves from the control of the AI once known as CORE. If your Oracle functions in similar ways, it cannot be trusted.
You should leave it to us, who we can and who we cannot trust, Chin Til’Trz of the ELOP. I have yet to hear of an insect that would have raised its voice to swear an oath.
The Grail Scanner is up and running. We are receiving resonating feedback signals from three potential Cypher locations. I am uploading the coordinates to your tactical interfaces.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Good work, Equis {STR_LeaderName}. You will be retrieving the Cypher from the Broadcasting Station near the Palatium Imperialis. Equis Denard, you go toe-to-toe with the Paragon in their training barracks at Neotroy Capitol. That leaves the Imperial War Monument at Port Maximus for myself.

Story message. Speaker: "Louise Weviere" (Oathbound, female) "Broadcasting Station" is the name of an in game exploration site. "Palatium Imperialis" is the name of a "Government Palace" landmark and in game sector (see custom sectors at the top of this xml). "training barracks" refers to "Paragon Training Barracks", an in game exploration site. "Neotroy Capitol" is the name of an in game sector (see custom sectors at the top of this xml). "Imperial War Monument" is the name of an in game exploration site. "Port Maximus" is the name of a "Spaceport" landmark and in game sector (see custom sectors at the top of this xml).
Finally, an actual challenge! A face-off against the elite of the Paragon is a battle that is worthy of my legend! You shall receive word of my victory ere moonset.
I expect nothing less. We have little time, and the Assembly are claiming the word “efficiency” for themselves. Let’s teach them they are wrong!

Go to the marked Exploration Sites and retrieve the Cyphers leading to the Prime Grail Configuration.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: wait for your allies to retrieve the Cyphers from their target locations, unless you are low on time. You mainly need to focus on the Cypher at the Broadcasting Station.)[/recommendedcol]
A task descripiton. For the task name see the corresponding entry in the Grails.xml. "Exploration Site" is the name of an in game structure type.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
The Paragon sent their best of the best.[br/]They would have claimed victory against someone less.[br/]Instead my legend continues to grow.[br/]Take this Cypher, my friends, and let it glow!
Excellent work, Equis Denard! I didn’t realize you had a weakness for poetry. I’m sure over time your talents there will… umm… develop to match your skills on the battlefield eventually.

I took the liberty of visiting the War Monument at Port Maximus in your name, Equis Weviere. Suffice it to say, after my heroic display there, the monument should be revised and dedicated to my deed and name. The last Cypher is ours!

Your proactive extension of your responsibilities is duly accepted, due to the unusual urgency of our mission, Equis Denard. But keep in mind that I won’t tolerate such operations behind my back a second time.

We have collected enough Cyphers to feed the decryption algorithms devised for this very purpose. Equis {STR_LeaderName}, your Seers have been instructed with the setup and monitoring of the Cypher analysis modules.
If all goes well, we will soon know the location of the Grail Configuration and have decrypted the access codes needed to enter its inner vault.
Let your Seers analyze the Cyphers to obtain the location of the Grail Configuration vault and its access codes.
A task descripiton. For the task name see the corresponding entry in the Grails.xml.
I have just received the word from my Seers: the decryption of the Cyphers is complete! I am transmitting the positioning and access code to your battlesuit data banks.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Excellent! I am looking at the received coordinates – the vault of the Grail lies in the vicinity of the Assembly territory, giving them a decisive edge in this race. Luckily, I already suspected this and made preparations…[br/][br/]To all hands: commence operation “Skylift”!
Mobile relay platform is reaching target position. All quantum carrier drones are initializing release thrusters...[br/][br/]Success! The eagle has landed!
Story message. Speaker: "Avatar" (AI unit, could be male or female)

Yes! With the Forward Relay Base deployed, we can send in our troops to make a rush for the Grail Configuration vault. Equis Denard, Equis {STR_LeaderName}, you have received the schematics to construct Orbital Relays near your own headquarters.

Story message. Speaker: "Louise Weviere" (Oathbound, female) "Forward Relay Base" is the name of an in game structure. "Orbital Relays" refers to "Orbital Relay Exploitation", an in game sector exploitation.

Thank you, Equis Weviere. This is highly impressive! But we must be cautious and not grow overconfident: not only the Assembly, but also their Apostate allies will do anything in their power to stop us from claiming the Grail!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Let them try! The more of their scavenging soldiers and false surgeons they send in, the greater our fame and victory will be!

Send an army with a hero to the location of the Prime Grail Configuration and claim it for the Oathbound.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: build an Orbital Relay Sector to quickly transport your armies to the Forward Relay Base of Louise Weviere.)[recommendedcol/]
A task descripiton. For the task name see the corresponding entry in the Grails.xml.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'. "Anomalous Site" is the name of an in game structure type.

The Palatium Imperialis! Even next to the tall city-scape of pompous Paragon architecture, the dome of the imperial palace is towering like a colossus from a forgotten era. I feel as if I can still hear the chanting masses gathering at the plaza of empires, witness their inebriant hysteria as the Emperor steps outside for public appearance…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
…IT IS TIME, ALIUNA. YOUR PEOPLE ARE WAITING. THE CORONATION MUST BEGIN.
Story message. Speaker: "CORE" (AI, genderless, see corresponding glossary entry)

I am ready. You know, I desired this moment ending my isolation to arrive. I only have one question left: once I enter the balcony and accept my new name and title, what will happen to the girl called Aliuna? Will she find any friends to play games with?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) Speaking as Empress Carminia as part of a dream vision.
YOU KNOW THE ANSWER. YOUR INTUITION HAS ALWAYS BEEN ONE OF YOUR STRENGTHS. IT IS WHAT YOU WERE DESTINED TO BECOME. WHAT YOUR PEOPLE NEED…
Story message. Speaker: "CORE" (AI, genderless, see corresponding glossary entry)
Reverend Nacri! I need to speak to you. My visions have returned. The girl from the dreams… it turns out she was Empress Carminia all along!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) For "Empress Carminia" see the corresponding glossary entry.

Prentice {STR_LeaderFirstName}, it is good to speak to you again, albeit I would appreciate it if you were less… intrusive the next time. But how can you say that the girl was Empress Carminia? Have you learned nothing from your past experience?
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)

Yes, I mean no… I’m not sure anymore. It’s all so confusing! If the girl I saw is Empress Carminia, how is it possible that she differed in her words and actions so much from the image of the sovereign and widely adored ruler that has been preserved up to the current date?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Nobody is born into a profession, not even an Empress. Everyone just tries to grow and adjust to the role in life that destiny or they themselves have sought out. Beyond the mask of perfection that a ruler has to wear, many shattered hopes and dreams may be buried.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male)
The ornate wall patterns, the crystalline formations… Even though this place looks ancient and alien, it feels like I have been here before…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

…need to carefully plan the detonation. The gravity bombs are supposed to disrupt the Nexus Network, not entirely destroy it. The Urmythians built their Grail Configurations to promote order. They didn’t intend their perfect apparatus to fall in the hands of anarchists.

Story message. Speaker: "Hologram of Emperor Tholian" (hologram is genderless, Tholian is a male Paragon character. See the corresponding glossary entry.) For "Nexus Network" see the corresponding glossary entry. "Urmythians" is the name of an extinct crystalline race.

The Urmythians also didn’t intend their bodies to turn into Cosmite and fuel the advanced technology of future galactic civilizations. If their predictions could be flawed, so can anyone’s, including your own.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) Speaking as Empress Carminia as part of a dream vision.

You say a controlled detonation will paralyze CORE long enough, but what if it doesn’t? Do you want to condemn all future generations to live under AI rule as we did? I won’t take that risk. This is our one chance for independence and we must take it!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) Speaking as Empress Carminia as part of a dream vision.

But not in such fashion! The destruction caused by an explosion of this magnitude could devastate the entire galaxy; a cataclysmic reaction! Remember, the Psionic potential induced by a gravity bomb is very fragile proof of my theory. You could die yourself, or even worse: succeed. For would you truly want to reign over humanity as an immortal god – for all eternity?
Story message. Speaker: "Hologram of Emperor Tholian" (hologram is genderless, Tholian is a male Paragon character. See the corresponding glossary entry.)

I will have to carry that burden. Or as CORE would say: it is my destiny.[br/][br/]But why do I even bother discussing this with a hologram? The Omega group contacted me that Ara’rael has moved in. The die is cast.

Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female) Speaking as Empress Carminia as part of a dream vision. "Omega group" was an anonymous group of hackers who created the Synthesis secret tech. "Ara'rael" is the name of an AI (a male hacker uploading his consciousness into cyber space).

Aliuna, please be reasonable. It is not my fault that the only person you can still trust is a hologram. Not all AI is bad. Take the prediction system of Archanon-8 for instance: it is built around a Grail Configuration of Knowledge and has never shown any signs of…

Story message. Speaker: "Hologram of Emperor Tholian" (hologram is genderless, Tholian is a male Paragon character. See the corresponding glossary entry.) "Archanon-8" is the name of a planet. "Grail Configuration of Knowledge" is the name of an in game structure. (it is not the same structure as the one found in this mission, but has the same general type)

Prediction system of Archanon-8? Oracle – I can’t believe it! And there is so much more: the Urmythians, the Omega group, Ara’rael… I don’t know how to explain any of this to the Reverend. But this is also not the right place and time to talk, there might still be dangers ahead.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
You have done well, Prentice {STR_LeaderFirstName}. The Grail Configuration is within your reach.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male) Last message is spoken from the perspective of Empress Carminia, since she reveals her identity in that sentence.
Reverend Nacri? You knew about the Grail Configurations? How is that possible?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
There is a simple explanation for my knowledge, {STR_LeaderFirstName}, and it is indeed time that you learned the truth. You see, I am Empress Carminia.
Story message. Speaker: "Reverend Nacri" (Celestian Ascended Teacher unit, male) Last message is spoken from the perspective of Empress Carminia, since she reveals her identity in that sentence.
You?! The Empress?! ... So this is how I got all the visions! You planted them in my mind, and then staged the charade about discerning their origin and meaning! But why me? Why at all?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Because you needed to be ready. Ready for the upcoming decisions. Ready for your future role… And the only way to prepare you was to let you relive the past and learn, so you could later avoid the mistakes that I made.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

You already noticed that the fate of the girl – my young self – and your own fate were oddly related. But what you couldn’t realize is that you are in fact me, and that I am you. You are the version of myself from the most similar alternate dimension, and I have brought you here to become Emperor of the new Star Union.

You already noticed that the fate of the girl – my young self – and your own fate were oddly related. But what you couldn’t realize is that you are in fact me, and that I am you. You are the version of myself from the most similar alternate dimension, and I have brought you here to become Empress of the new Star Union.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

This… is absurd! It can’t be true. You really must be crazy! The most obvious disproof of this nonsense is that I am a man![br/][br/]Besides, I have no interest in becoming Emperor of a new Star Union.
This… is absurd! It can’t be true. You really must be crazy![br/][br/]Besides, I have no interest in becoming Empress of a new Star Union.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

It is called alternate dimension for a reason. But it also doesn’t matter whether you believe me with this or not. What is important is that you accept your future role as Emperor and that you keep Oracle as your advisory system and counter-pole to your power.

It is called alternate dimension for a reason. But it also doesn’t matter whether you believe me with this or not. What is important is that you accept your future role as Empress and that you keep Oracle as your advisory system and counter-pole to your power.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

The new Star Union needs a strong Emperor, one that can mend the schism between the different human races following the Cataclysm. But it also needs the administrative potential and objectiveness of a computer system to govern and connect the many worlds that will unite under its banner.

The new Star Union needs a strong Empress, one that can mend the schism between the different human races following the Cataclysm. But it also needs the administrative potential and objectiveness of a computer system to govern and connect the many worlds that will unite under its banner.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

Not even the Oathbound are immune to the friction caused by different standpoints and philosophies. The Prime Grail Configuration is like a match that could light the fuse of another gravity bomb. But when used for right, it can be the seed from which a new empire is grown.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

The Prime Grail Configuration is under our control! By now, the other factions have realized what a powerful artifact we were after. They will expect that we constitute our claim as Star Union heirs, and then decide if they have to declare us their enemy.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Codran Lex and his Paragon clearly desire the return of an Emperor, while the ELOP Confederation fears such centralized power as much as it fears an AI system like Oracle. We can’t make friends with either without abandoning some of the core rules of our Oathbound society. But do we want to force our ideals onto all other races without compromise?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Oracle foresaw this situation. Since we left Archanon-8, I have been carrying the secret instructions and binding authority of the High Paladius to make you the first Oathbound Emperor. Congratulations, Equis {STR_LeaderName}! You have been destined for greatness!

Oracle foresaw this situation. Since we left Archanon-8, I have been carrying the secret instructions and binding authority of the High Paladius to make you the first Oathbound Empress. Congratulations, Equis {STR_LeaderName}! You have been destined for greatness!
Story message. Speaker: "Louise Weviere" (Oathbound, female) "High Paladius" is an Oathbound title.

Which vile villain plot do I have to witness unfolding here? The equality as it is preserved in the Circle of Heroes is the only true form of government any Paladin can recognize. None but the ELOP Confederation seem to share this vision. It is to them that we must bring our oath!

And abandon Oracle, whose wisdom has guided us back into the light? What are we Paladins without the advice of our Seers? Little more than generals stomping around in battle mechs! Even the Code d’Equise was devised by the ones you seek to abandon!

You talk about the Code d’Equise, but it is clear that you have no understanding of its meaning. Virtue, heroism and greatness are what drives our society forward. The Seers were bold enough to start the epic tale of the Oathbound. They will find new strength without Oracle!

Carminia was right about one thing… the Grail Configuration has revealed that we Oathbound are not as united as I always believed. Whichever decision I take, there will be Paladins and Seers to disagree. I must do what seems best not only for us, but for all races. I will…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

I accept this blessing given by you in the name of the High Paladius, Equis Weviere. As Emperor, I shall continue to serve the populace and inspire them to follow us into a better future! It is a journey that I can only dare to embark on with the continued support of the Circle and Oracle.

I accept this blessing given by you in the name of the High Paladius, Equis Weviere. As Empress, I shall continue to serve the populace and inspire them to follow us into a better future! It is a journey that I can only dare to embark on with the continued support of the Circle and Oracle.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Treachery! Both of you openly defy the second noble command, which forbids us to rise above one another! If this is the will of the Circle of Heroes, I shall part with haste. As the last true Paladin, Equis Denard will face and defeat this new monstrosity born from broken oaths and dishonor!

It is true that the people of all different species are in need of a strong Emperor to lead them into a better future, and I shall accept this calling of destiny. But the history of the Star Union has laid open the dangers of an AI system deciding the lives of people of flesh and blood. I cannot allow such a dictate to return.

It is true that the people of all different species are in need of a strong Empress to lead them into a better future, and I shall accept this calling of destiny. But the history of the Star Union has laid open the dangers of an AI system deciding the lives of people of flesh and blood. I cannot allow such a dictate to return.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Are you exemplifying the power of CORE to consolidate your own claim as undisputed ruler? This is madness! Revoke this decision immediately, or I will be forced to brand you as an Apostate!

Fear not, Equis Weviere: I shall charge against this snake clad in blackguard steel and wrest the Prime Grail Configuration from its poisoned fangs. After my performance, you will reconsider your definition of heroism!
Poor {STR_LeaderFirstName}, did you not learn from my example? You choose the hardest path. May it lead you to happier shores than it led the girl I once was.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

Though I am honored by the trust of the Circle, I must reject the offer to become an Empress under Oracle’s rule. The future of the Oathbound lies in the cooperation with other races. Equis Denard is right: we must seek the dialogue with the ELOP Confederation.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Unacceptable! Oath and Oracle are what turned you into Paladins. By abandoning either you are betraying who you are. In the name of the High Paladius and his Seers I declare both of you to be renegades. Surrender your battlesuits now, or suffer the consequences!
Equis {STR_LeaderName}, word of your new claim and quarrel is travelling fast. The other commanders are sending you their regards – or denunciations.
Story message. Speaker: "Paladin Exemplar" (Oathbound unit, can be any gender)

Hail {STR_LeaderName}, future Emperor of the Star Union! My instincts have not been fooled; I haven’t felt such energy and determination in a person since I met the young Carminia. The Paragon will follow you faithfully into battle, my Emperor – together we shall re-erect this Empire!

Hail {STR_LeaderName}, future Empress of the Star Union! My instincts have not been fooled; I haven’t felt such energy and determination in a person since I met the young Carminia. The Paragon will follow you faithfully into battle, my Empress – together we shall re-erect this Empire!

Deplorable {STR_LeaderName}! You have found new power and potential, but decided to waste it on the false hopes of anarchists and defectors. Once my pacifier division is done with you and your kind, I will pray for the one true Emperor to return!

Deplorable {STR_LeaderName}! You have found new power and potential, but decided to waste it on the false hopes of anarchists and defectors. Once my pacifier division is done with you and your kind, I will pray to the one true Empress to return!

Hox’Krit’Pat, {STR_LeaderName}! It is with great joy that the ELOP Confederation welcomes you and all Oathbound willing to follow as new members of our egalitarian alliance. May we stand strong together, to defend against the remaining threats to peace and prosperity!
Story message. Speaker: "Chin Til'Trz" (Kir'Ko, male) "Hox'Krit'Pat" is a friendly Kir'Ko greeting.

Power-hungry {STR_LeaderName}! We were mistaken about your alleged dedication to freedom and equality. But we can take consolation in the fact that your former friend Agley Denard is brave enough to seek our support on his own. By Ro’Qwer’Z, the swarm will not fail him!
Story message. Speaker: "Chin Til'Trz" (Kir'Ko, male) "Ro'Qwer'Z" is the name of a male Kir'Ko character.
Peace be with you, {STR_LeaderFirstName} of the Oathbound! You have proven that the interests of Oathbound and Amazons can coexist without rivalry. Where you guide your people, we will follow.

We were right to distrust the words of a stranger with no interest in nature or its preservation. The Prime Grail Configuration is a dangerous tool which could disrupt the innate balance of this galaxy. We must ensure it doesn’t stay in the wrong hands!

Proclaiming yourself new Emperor of the Star Union? You are bolder than I expected! The Syndicate Houses approve of a nobility returning to the highest position of power. You can count on our support!

Proclaiming yourself new Empress of the Star Union? You are bolder than I expected! The Syndicate Houses approve of a nobility returning to the highest position of power. You can count on our support!
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)

It is a shame that I have been wasting my attention on you, {STR_LeaderName}. But none of your actions have proven to be in best interest of House Ny’dar and therefore this galaxy. I can’t allow a powerful artifact like the Prime Grail Configuration to stay under your control.
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)
A header name of a task.

Greetings, outsiders! I am Matriarch Mahina of the Neogalactic Sisterhood. Be advised to keep the appropriate distance to our borders. Trespassers who do not heed this warning will be fired upon by our Huntresses.
Story message. Speaker: "Mahina Wateka" (Amazon, female) "Matriarch" is an Amazon title. "Neogalactic Sisterhood" is the name of the Amazon empire.

Greetings, Mahina of the Amazons! You can be assured: we do not seek conflict. It is sad to hear such cold words of aggression when I was hoping our people could reach out to each other in cooperation.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

We have heard words of this fashion before, when the ELOP Confederation sent their envoys to Pokaniwa. They spoke much about politics, but showed little understanding for what we Amazons deem important. If you prove to me that our goals can align, I might reconsider our position.
Story message. Speaker: "Mahina Wateka" (Amazon, female) "Pokaniwa" is the name of a planet.
I am willing to learn and to help. However, no promise can be made before I know more about the nature of these goals that your people pursue.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

A promising answer. First you must learn, then you can judge! Travel to the DNA Vault at the Living Museum of Natural History. You will find a profound collection of seeds, tools and data pads. Once there, I will tell you more.

Story message. Speaker: "Mahina Wateka" (Amazon, female) "DNA Vault" is the name of an in game exploration site. "Living Muesum of Natural History" is the name of an in game sector (see custom sector names at the top of this xml).
A name of a task. "Arcadian" is the name of an in game clime.

Mahina Wateka has asked you to clear the DNA Vault and obtain a variety of seeds, instructions and tools, which will help you to understand the Amazon cause.[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: completing this quest will anger the Syndicate leader!)[/firecol]
If I understand the book-keeping of the data pads correctly, this seed library we have acquired contains everything that is needed to turn a barren wasteland into a lush jungle. Incredible!
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Impressive, isn’t it? Terratech collected, fostered and altered the DNA characteristics of several million herbal species in order to perfect their Arcadian Seed Library. It is the birthing pod of creation, which can spread a natural paradise even to the most inhospitable worlds.
Story message. Speaker: "Mahina Wateka" (Amazon, female) For "Terratech" see the correpsonding glossary entry.
And this is what you Amazons seek to accomplish? To protect and nourish life in its oldest and primary form?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

It is a part of it, though we care just as much about the animals and beasts inhabiting our exalted gardens. Humanity has a long history of exploiting and destroying its natural surroundings. Mending the scars and wounds caused by our common ancestors is a long and indispensable task.

Take this planet for instance: Union Prime in its current state is at the brink of a complete ecological collapse. Natural forests have long vanished from the urbanized landscape and the Void itself is tearing at the fundamental integrity of reality.

To understand the value of what we seek to accomplish, you must yourself become a part of the healing process that could still save the planet. You possess the tools and seedlings to rejuvenate the land and rid it of its different scars. Now it is time for you to act!

Mahina Wateka wants you to participate in the healing process of Union Prime. Use the Arcadian Restoration and Rapid Reforestation operation from the Terratech vault to spread Arcadian forests on the planet, and remove the Abyssal Tear hazards from its surface![br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: to use a Strategic Operation, you must first prime it in the "operations" interface and later launch it when ready.)[recommendedcol/]
A task description. "Arcadian Restoration" and "Rapid Reforastation" are names of in game strategic operations. "Abyssal Tear" is the name of an in game world map hazard.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

The restoration of Union Prime’s eco systems has only begun, but with dedication and the right allies it might be completed one day. Thank you, {STR_LeaderFirstName} of the Oathbound. You have proven that cooperation between our two races can lead to a prospering relationship.
Look what we have here: a newcomer in a robot suit… You are talking to the Lady of the illustrious and fabulous House Ny’dar, first and most privileged of the ruling Syndicate houses.
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)

House Ny’dar? If this is the best the Syndicate can muster these days, your war with the Assembly truly must be going badly. Don’t you think it is time to leave your dreams of Syndicate hegemony behind and join a more equal alliance of resistance against the Assembly threat?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

It is clear that you are new to the refined game of diplomacy, or you would know that insults and dispraise are the wrong tools when searching for an ally. But I’ll be forthcoming and pretend the first part of this conversation never happened. How about you try again, and this time, start your speech with a gift?
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)
You are wrong if you think you can patronize me, Mila of House Ny’dar. I have no intention of paying tribute to a ruler whose power is entirely based on the exploitation of her people.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Always these preconceptions! I say “gift”, you hear “tribute”. I say “beloved Lady”, you hear “hedonistic monarch”. Don’t you think it is time to look beyond your own nose and learn about the history and traditions of the society you so openly despise?
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)

I will even help you with that part – see, we too can do good! – and I’ll make it easy: in the Paragon archives of Krotian Watch you can find the “Prima Dynastia”, a chronicle from the history of the first Syndicate empire which starts with the ascension of the Eight Gilded Dynasties and ends with the pacification of the Star Union. Bring it to me, and I will teach you new understanding.

Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female) "Krotian Watch" is the name of an in game sector (see custom sector names at the top of this xml). "Prima Dynastia" is the name of a chronicle. The "Eight Gilded Dynasties" are the Syndicate families founding the first Syndicate Empire.
Very well. I shall give you the benefit of the doubt for a brief while. But I have a pretty clear intuition about what kind of history and traditions I will be finding within that book.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Mila of House Ny'dar has asked you to retrieve the "Prima Dynastia", containing the chronicles of ancient Syndicate history. It could be an important step towards improving the relations between Syndicate and Oathbound.[br/][br/][firecol](Warning: completing this quest will anger the Amazon leader!)[/firecol]
Find the "Prima Dynastia" within the archives of the Paragon.
I have recovered the chronicle you were asking for, Mila of House Ny’dar. You thought it could change my view on the Syndicate people. Well, I am listening…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Ahh, the “Prima Dynastia”! It looks just as ancient and yellowed as I always imagined. Let’s see… a-ha, yes, this chapter needs to change… and that one… and that one…
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)
Wait a second - you are altering the content of your own chronicle!? Is this the kind of respect for the past and its accomplishments that you are trying to teach me?
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

History is written by the victors, {STR_LeaderName}. You should thank me for taking some of the ancient, dusted and arrogant families down their high horse. It will help to keep them in check after we finished our negotiations concerning the “more equal alliance” as you called it.
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)

Don’t look at me surprised like that! We from House Ny’dar know more than any other Syndicate house when time demands change. I am flexible enough to make some compromises when signing pacts of cooperation with people following a different ideology. The question is, are you?
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)

I… will be, as long as good faith is shown on both sides. Concessions will have to be made. I am talking about slavery, civil rights, the distribution of wealth… In return, we can pledge our protection to Syndicate colonies, send provisions, machinery...
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Good. Very good, in fact. But first you must do me a favor and make me a special exemplar of your advanced robo-suits. One without weapons, but with the proper elegance and ceremonial endowment to suit a lady from a Syndicate house. My mother has been pestering me about it for ages.
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)

This seems like an unusually vain request given the importance of our negotiations. But since it won’t include any strictly military components, I shall see that we can get this last obstacle between our two people out of the way.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

To seal the new pact of cooperation between the Syndicate and the Oathbound, Mila of House Ny'dar has asked you to frabricate and share a unique unarmed "battlesuit" with her, which she claims to need for her mother.
An unarmed battlesuit designed to match the standards in comfort and accessoires required by a Syndicate noble.
Here it is, Mila of House Ny’dar, the luxury mech you deemed important enough to delay our peace negotiations. I hope it was worth all the trouble.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
Excellent! Let’s both pray it is crafted to my mother’s satisfaction. Allow me to take her out… ah, yes, there is the old Nexus daemon casing.

Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female) "Nexus daemon" refers to a gadget used to store the daemon AI of a person who uploaded her consciousness into cyberspace. "Nexus" refers to "Nexus Network" (see the corresponding glossary entry). At the end of the Heritor campaign, Shae Mara uploads her consciousness into the Nexus Network to escape.
Take her out? Daemon casing? I better won’t even ask…
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

Finally, after all this time living in between bad code and broken data. You have done well, Lady Mila of House Ny’dar. This new body may not be perfect, but it will do much better than the Sentinel models we tried out last time.
Story message. Speaker: "Shae Mara (avatar form)" (AI, previously female Syndicate)

The Assembly have completed the construction of their own Grail Frequency Scanner. There is no doubt that the accursed Apostates shared this knowledge with the enemy. In any case, we will have to speed up our own efforts!

Status update: The Assembly have now collected all the Cyphers needed to find the Prime Grail Configuration, and are readying them for analysis. My agents are attempting to slow down the progress, but we cannot rely on their success. The Assembly are getting close!

Equis Denard, Equis {STR_LeaderName}, we are about to get company. The Assembly have found the Prime Grail Configuration. Their troops are on the move, but as long as we defend the Grail site, we can keep our advantage.

Equis Denard, Equis {STR_LeaderName}, we are reaching the point of no return. The Assembly have decoded the Cyphers and found the Prime Grail Configuration. Soon they will have reached its inner vault. We must hurry to catch them in time, or all will be lost!
Integration of the Prime Grail Configuration complete. Assembly nanite network ready to launch in 3…[br/]2…[br/]1…

I welcome you all into the neural network of the United Generations of the Assembly. Don’t be alarmed; the abundance of voices can be overwhelming at first, but our multiplexer L0G3N-1 will guide you through this experience. Reassembly is about to commence. This time, there will be no resistance.
Story message. Speaker: "Ellen Shaw" (Assembly, female) "United Generations of the Assembly" is the name of the Assembly empire.

The death of a single individual is meaningless. My ideas and ideals will live on in the collective memory of billions. What the First started 200 years ago, the United Generations of the Assembly will bring to completion!
The grasp of the Abyss is tightening, crushing my feeble body within its black clutches. No, this cannot be! I am Paragon! I am immortal! Protect me, my Empress! I was your most…
Stay away! A Lady of Syndicate blood is untouchable! Will nobody listen!? I will use the Alpha Strain to grow tentacles, breath poison, rip you all into pieces… Ahhh!
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)
The tale of a true hero must end with great sacrifice. My body may die and rot away, but the legend of my deeds will be remembered and sung for eternity!

The strength of the swarm is dwindling. Forgive me my brethren, your Swarm Herald has failed you! We will live on through the dreams we passed on to the past hatches. May they find peace where we couldn’t!
Any famous last words are hypocrisy. Everyone just fears death, the ending, finality… Oracle, why did you have to abandon your servants?

Death is a natural part of life. Yet it is the only aspect of nature that we Amazons couldn’t truly embrace. When a tree dies, new saplings will take its place. But what will happen when all seeds of this world have rotted and withered?

The battle for Union Prime is over, the Prime Grail Configuration secured. I would have hoped for more alliances and less bloodshed, but the differences between the factions of the past and the present are not easy to overcome.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)
A strong symbol is needed, one which can invoke trust and stability on the different worlds of this galaxy with all its different people. After all that happened here, I know what needs to be done.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

You do indeed, my newfound ally and friend. The Egalitarian League of Planets is thankful for all of your actions. After invasions and wars wearing down our alliance over the past few years, there is reason for hope once more.
Confidence where confidence is deserved! This is a momentous occasion for every Paragon. After two centuries of bitter darkness, a new sun is rising to herald the rebirth of an empire!

I am proud of you, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. Your experience as Celestian student and Oathbound Equis were good preparation for the responsibilities to come. My task as mentor is complete. I can part, knowing that the future of this galaxy rests in capable hands.
Story message. Speaker: "Empress Carminia" (Paragon, female; see corresponding glossary entry.)

My huntresses gave report that you are helping the despicable Syndicate House leader. Her Xenoplague experiments are an abomination against nature! Since you have dealings with people of this mindset, I am forced to terminate our diplomatic relations.

It has come to my attention that you are cooperating with the lowly Mahina Wateka. The Amazons have been hostile to us, ever since they discovered our Xenoplague experiments. Helping them means to harm the goals of House Ny’dar.
Story message. Speaker: "Mila of House Ny'dar" (Syndicate, female)
Have you lost your mind, Equis {STR_LeaderName}? No Paladin should intentionally harm one another. It is what separates us from the Apostates.
Without the help of my Oathbound allies, there is no hope of securing the Prime Grail Configuration before the Assembly does. I am fighting for a lost cause.
Story message. Speaker: "Aliuna Lyonesse" (Oathbound, can be both male or female)

We accept the tribute you have paid to the Paragon. However, be aware that hostilities between our people cannot cease while you are opposing the will of the Prefect. Know that the resources you sent us will serve to restore the Star Union to its former glory.
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon" (represented by Techno Prophet unit, male)
